intro: Dampiera restiacea, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and is well adapted to arid environments. Dampiera restiacea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
